title: Tesla posts record profit and says it will sell half a million cars this year
description: Tesla reported by far its best quarterly profit Wednesday and said it still hopes to hit its target of half a million car sales this year.

title: Obama delivers a blistering rebuke of Trump in his return to the campaign trail
A previously unknown human organ may have been discovered by scientists
description: It's hard to imagine there is a part of the human body that's gone unnoticed by doctors after centuries of medical research.

title: A California Black Lives Matter chapter is fundraising to get some of its members trained in gun safety
description: Black Lives Matter's Sacramento chapter wants to sponsor 10 Black people for gun safety training in an effort to keep its organization members safe.

title: Watch NASA spacecraft successfully land on an asteroid
description: NASA completed its first-ever mission to land on an asteroid 200 million miles from Earth.

title: New images show NASA spacecraft's historic landing on asteroid
description: New images taken by the OSIRIS-REx mission show the historic first touchdown of a NASA spacecraft on the near-Earth asteroid Bennu. The spacecraft collected a sample that will be returned to Earth in 2023.

title: Democrats to boycott vote to advance Barrett nomination
description: Senate Judiciary Democrats, facing criticism from the left that they have not done more to question the legitimacy of the Supreme Court confirmation proceedings for Amy Coney Barrett, plan to take the extraordinary step of boycotting a key committee vote on Thursday.

title: Two words that explain why Donald Trump is losing
description:
• Analysis: The real reason Trump walked out on that '60 Minutes' interview
• Trump pushes for last-minute foreign policy wins that would be hard for Biden to reverse
• Analysis: It's becoming clear what Trump might do if he loses

title: Experts warn US will see dramatic rise in Covid-19 cases
description: CNN's Nick Watt reports on the rising number of Covid-19 hospitalizations states in the US as coronavirus task force member Dr. Scott Atlas pushes for herd immunity against the surgeon general's recommendation.

title: Short-form video app Quibi shutting down
description: Much like its content, Quibi didn't last very long.

title: Obama blasts Trump's foreign bank account
description: Former President Barack Obama attacked President Trump's continued business dealings with China and his recently revealed foreign bank account while campaigning in support of Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden.

title: See Obama's reaction to Trump's conspiracy tweets
Why it's so hard to dethrone Google
description: If you use the internet, Google is practically inescapable. This is most evident in how we search for almost everything online — so much so that "Google" is synonymous with search.

title: The 2020 election has confirmed to China that democracy is a circus
description: In 2016, when nearly everyone in China thought that Hillary Clinton would win the White House, one group in particular was confident of a Donald Trump victory. Back when most goods flowed from China, merchants in the trading hub of Yiwu received four times more orders for Trump than for Clinton merchandise.

title: Trump administration notifies Congress of $1.8 billion in proposed weapons sales to Taiwan
description: The US formally notified Congress of a proposed $1.8 billion in advanced weapons systems sales to Taiwan -- a move sure to increase tensions with Beijing.

title: Purdue Pharma to plead guilty, pay more than $8 billion and shut down for its role in opioid crisis
description: Purdue Pharma, the maker of OxyContin, has agreed to plead guilty to three federal criminal charges for its role in creating the nation's opioid crisis and will pay more than $8 billion and close down the company.

title: How to read Pope Francis' message of love for LGBTQ people
description: The highest Catholic in all the world has pushed the door towards LGBTQ inclusion open further by pronouncing that same-sex couples, historically excluded from traditional religious and civil institutions like marriage, ought to have legal protections that recognize their unions.

title: Shakhtar produces stunning Champions League upset to defeat Real Madrid
description: Shakhtar Donetsk produced one of the most memorable upsets in Champions League history, beating 13-time winner Real Madrid 3-2 on home soil.

title: France's war over secularism, freedom of speech and religious equality reignites after teacher beheaded
description: France was irrevocably changed by the Paris terror attacks of January 2015. Three days of violence began with a massacre at the offices of satirical magazine Charlie Hebdo, which had previously published controversial cartoons depicting the Prophet Mohammed. They ended with a siege at a kosher supermarket.

title: Nigerian President calls for calm after protesters shot
description: Nigeria's President Muhammadu Buhari has appealed for "understanding and calm" after protests against police brutality in Lagos turned bloody on Tuesday, with eyewitnesses telling CNN that multiple demonstrators had been shot dead by Army soldiers, who then took the bodies away.

title: Inside Melania Trump's unprecedented campaign trail absence
Black women's battle for the ballot
description: Historian and author of "Vanguard" Martha S. Jones and trailblazing civil rights activist Xernona Clayton talk about Black women's historic fight to be heard and counted.

title: Japanese man invents 'edible' plastic bag alternative to save Nara's sacred deer
description: A local entrepreneur in the Japanese tourist destination of Nara has developed an alternative to plastic shopping bags, to protect the town's sacred deer.

title: Which US state's economy is faring best during the pandemic
description: The Back-to-Normal Index from CNN Business and Moody's Analytics shows which states are closest to and furthest from their pre-pandemic economies.

title: Cop under investigation after wearing Trump mask at polling place
description: A photograph of a uniformed Miami police officer wearing a "Trump 2020" protective mask at a polling place sparked controversy and condemnation.

title: Stephen Colbert moved to tears by Dolly Parton's voice
description: Host Stephen Colbert teared up when country music star Dolly Parton sang "Bury Me Beneath the Willow" on "The Late Show."

title: 'Borat' sequel somehow still manages to serve up audacious surprises
description: Like any sequel, "Borat Subsequent Moviefilm" faces the challenge of what to do for an encore, 14 years and a big box-office haul later. Somehow, though, Sacha Baron Cohen hasn't lost the power to deliver audacious surprises, with enough explosive, not-suitable-for-anywhere laughs to power through the flatter patches this sort of exercise inevitably yields.

title: More than 100 dead as Vietnam reels from 'worst floods in decades'
description: More than 100 people are dead and thousands of homes have been submerged in some of Vietnam's most severe floods in decades, with authorities warning that more bad weather is to come.

title: Reese Witherspoon says iconic 'Legally Blonde' scene was cut short
description: During a virtual reunion with the "Legally Blonde" cast, Reese Witherspoon says that the iconic "bend and snap scene" was intended to be a musical number.

title: This super-beetle can survive being run over by a car
description: Scientists developing new materials are studying an unlikely source of strength: a beetle that can withstand being run over by a car.

title: Dad's 'crap' pet portraits raise thousands for charity
description: A British man has raised thousands of pounds for charity after his unconventional drawings of people's pets went viral.

title: How a popular uprising turned into a political front
description: Pierre Issa arrived at a meeting with French President Emmanuel Macron on August 6 with 10 stitches on his face, two chipped teeth and a few broken bones. "I wasn't sure if I could make it today, so I wrote you an open letter just in case," Issa recalled telling Macron.

title: Police investigate attacks on antique artworks on Berlin's Museum Island
description: Berlin police are investigating an attack that caused extensive damage to works of art and artifacts displayed at three locations on the German capital's Museum Island.

title: Amazon will let some employees work from home until mid-2021
description: Amazon plans to let some of its employees work from home until the middle of next year.

title: Before you get a flu shot, get good sleep to increase its effectiveness, experts say
These voters are still undecided. Here's why
description: These Ohio voters watched the first Presidential debate and were still struggling to decide on a candidate, in the final days of the election they explain why.

title: There's a battle for the suburbs in Florida. Who will win?
description: The President will need voters in the suburbs of Florida if he hopes to retake the White House. CNN's John King explains why.

title: Can this app help save the travel industry?
description: Global travel has ground to a near halt due to the coronavirus pandemic but now CommonPass, a new digital health passport, hopes to reverse the course. CNN's Anna Stewart reports.

title: Hollywood stuntwoman Sarah Lezito is 'bored' of competing against men
description: She's been dubbed the world's greatest stuntwoman and has worked alongside Hollywood stars such as Scarlett Johansson, but Sarah Lezito shows no sign of slowing down.

title: Soccer player suffers hortrific testicle injury
description: Flamengo defender Gustavo Henrique is recovering from a testicle injury sustained during his side's 5-1 victory over Corinthians.

title: The world's best hotel bars (and what to drink there)
description: Hotel bars are the fast track to opulence.

title: Lionel Messi breaks Champions League record as teenagers give Barcelona hope for the future
description: Lionel Messi has become the first player to score in 16 consecutive Champions League seasons after netting in Barcelona's 5-1 win over Hungarian side Ferencvaros on Tuesday.

title: Kim Kardashian West at 40: Looking back at a style evolution
description: Scrolling through images of outfits worn over the years by Kim Kardashian West, who turns 40 today, one thing remains consistent throughout: how confident she looks in even the most questionable of them.

title: Rihanna's latest Savage X Fenty campaign stars Black breast cancer survivors
description: Rihanna is using her latest Savage X Fenty campaign to shine a spotlight on Black breast cancer survivors.
